notes: This JSON outlines the learning areas and detailed sub-strands typically taught in Kenya CBC Grade 1, aligned with the latest KICD curriculum designs (rationalized as of 2025). It summarises key learning areas across strands and sub-strands. For official learning outcome codes and full designs, refer to the Kenya Institute of Curriculum Development (KICD) documentation.

strands.name: Listening and Speaking
strands.description: Developing pronunciation, vocabulary, and oral communication skills through themed activities.
subtopics: Pronunciation and vocabulary (e.g., linking letters to sounds, using theme-related words, responding to instructions)
Using facial expressions and gestures in conversations
Responding verbally and non-verbally to instructions

strands.name: Reading
strands.description: Building pre-reading, word reading, fluency, and comprehension skills.
subtopics: Word reading (identifying and pronouncing words with target sounds)
Fluency (reading at appropriate speed with expression)
Comprehension (making predictions, answering questions, inferring meanings)

strands.name: Language Use
strands.description: Applying grammar structures like verbs, pronouns, tenses, and possessives in context.
subtopics: Verb 'to be', subject-verb agreement, pronouns (I, you)
Singular and plurals, present simple and continuous tenses
Simple past tense, demonstratives, prepositions, articles, possessives
Common and proper nouns, adjectives, yes/no questions

strands.name: Writing
strands.description: Developing pre-writing, handwriting, and spelling skills for effective communication.
subtopics: Handwriting (forming lower case letters, writing left to right)
Spelling (spelling 3-5 letter words, forming letters correctly)

strands.name: Numbers
strands.description: Developing number sense through pre-number activities, whole numbers, addition, and subtraction.
subtopics: Pre-number activities (sorting, matching, ordering, creating patterns)
Whole numbers (counting forward/backward, representing, reading/writing numbers 1-50, patterns)
Addition (modeling, using symbols, adding single/double digits up to 50, patterns)
Subtraction (modeling, using symbols, subtracting single/double digits up to 50, patterns)

strands.name: Measurement
strands.description: Exploring length, mass, capacity, time, and money using arbitrary units and Kenyan currency.
subtopics: Capacity (comparing, measuring with arbitrary units, reusing containers)
Time (days of the week, months, relating to activities)
Money (identifying coins/notes up to sh.50, counting, buying items)

strands.name: Geometry
strands.description: Identifying lines and shapes, drawing, and making patterns.

strands.name: Social Environment
strands.description: Understanding personal hygiene, home, family needs, school, and market roles.

Family needs (basic needs, classifying items, food from plants/animals, healthy food selection)

strands.name: Natural Environment
strands.description: Observing weather, soil, and sounds in the environment.
subtopics: Weather and the sky (appearance day/night, conditions, recording)
Sound (identifying, creating sounds, discriminating danger sounds)

strands.name: Resources in Our Environment
strands.description: Identifying and conserving water, plants, and animals.
subtopics: Animals (domestic animals, food sources, basic care)

strands.name: Healthy Practices
strands.description: Promoting healthy habits and personal hygiene.
subtopics: Healthy habits (activities to stay healthy like playing, washing hands, brushing teeth)

strands.name: Foods
strands.description: Identifying foods, using senses, and healthy eating habits.
subtopics: Using our senses to identify food (sight, smell, taste)

subtopics: First aid (basic procedures for cuts, etc.)

strands.description: Developing skills in movement, music, and art through exploration.
